title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When attempting to open a file in the workbench that is already open in another editor, nothing happens. No warning message or error message is displayed.
EB: When attempting to open a file in the workbench that is already open in another editor, a warning message should be displayed indicating that the file is already open and asking if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed stating that all files must be closed before opening a new editor for the same file.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will pop up with the java file opened. Close it.
3. Go back to the Java Perspective and open a java file by simply double-clicking on it. The file is now opened in the workbench.
4. Right-click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. The issue should occur, where nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed.
